events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on the morning of June 1st and submitted a claim for damages.
After reviewing the initial claim details, the case was categorised as an Auto Accident due to collision with another vehicle.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the claimant through the next steps of the vehicle damage assessment.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer promptly, assuring them the claim is being processed.
Customer was asked to provide photographs of the damaged vehicle and a police report related to the accident.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including vehicle photos and the official police accident report.
An investigation into the vehicle collision was initiated to verify damage details and liability before settlement.
The investigation concluded that the claimant is not at fault, confirming the extent of damages caused by the collision.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering the full cost of car repairs desired by the claimant.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and confirmed acceptance via email.
Official approval of the claim was granted based on the accepted settlement and verified documentation.
The insurance payment covering all agreed vehicle repairs was successfully transferred to the claimant's account.
Following payment issuance and claim resolution, the insurance case was formally closed and documented.
All claim records and supporting documents were securely archived for future reference and compliance.
